definition: to move (i.e. relocate oneself)/to move (sth relatively heavy or bulky)/to shift/to copy indiscriminately
to praise sb in his presence
knife, saw, ax and hatchet (idiom); facing torture and execution
to deserve what one gets (punishment, mishap etc) (idiom)
deceived by a pretense of reason (idiom)
the morning dew will swiftly dissipate (idiom); fig. ephemeral and precarious nature of human existence
to say one thing and do another (idiom)
rooted to the spot (idiom); too terrified to move
to present slaughtered or live animals
lit. ask passers-by how to build one's house (idiom); fig. to have no idea what to do/without a clue
lit. punish one, warn one hundred (idiom)/fig. to make an example of sb/also written 懲一儆百|惩一儆百[cheng2 yi1 jing3 bai3]
Men of Zheng fighting over their respective ages (idiom)/a futile quarrel
lit. to burn both fragrant orchids and stinking weeds (idiom); fig. to destroy indiscriminately the noble and common/the rain falls on the just and unjust alike
